New Records: The 30-point defeat marks the largest margin of loss in a season opener in franchise history, surpassing the previous record of 29 points set in their 2001 season opener against Orlando.
Key Match Events: Toronto started strong, leading for much of the first quarter with an advantage of up to seven points.
Cleveland rallied, closing the quarter with a 13-5 run to take a 33-32 lead.
The Cavaliers never trailed again, widening their lead to 69-49 by halftime.
By the end of the third quarter, the margin had grown to 26 points, prompting both teams to rest their starters for most of the final period.
Pre-Game Insights: A sold-out crowd of 19,800 fans, including former Raptors players from the past 29 seasons and recently inducted Hall of Famer Vince Carter, filled the arena.
Post-Match Reflections: Scottie Barnes, the team's only All-Star from last season, managed just nine points on 3-for-14 shooting and recorded a game-worst minus-33 rating.
Guard Immanuel Quickley, who also re-signed with a five-year contract extension, left the game in the second quarter with a right pelvic injury.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Isaac Okoro #35 of the Cleveland Cavaliers dunks the ball during the game against the Toronto Raptors.
